111.content:
As Finn woke up to the smell of Jake cooking bacon pancakes he found a new peace he'd never been able to experience before with all the commotion going on in the vast land of Ooo. Every day Finn and Jake would run across the land to save princesses and help anyone in need, but recently not very much had been going on, and Finn, Jake and BMO had found themselves stuck at home. Jake had begun cooking classes with breakfast princess every morning at 8:00 so he'd have something to do, and BMO found that on his free time he enjoyed dancing with Bikini Babes and listening to music. As for Finn, he didn't do much, but he did eat. every morning he found himself eating a little more than the last. Until it became one extra helping, then two, then eventually three, but this morning something strange happened.
After he finished his breakfast he got a prismgram from Princess Bubblegum, urging him to arrive at her castle immediately. Finn hopped on jake's now expanded body and they took off. Finn could've sworn he noticed Jake's legs quiver and his clenched teeth strain a groan when Finn got on his back. By the time they reached the Candy Kingdom Jake was too tired to make it all the way go the castle so he figured that if they walked not only could he get Finn to excercise a little, but he could rest his back from where Finn sat. As Finn got off of Jake the Candy Kingdom's citizen's mouth's gaped, they hadn't seen Finn in months, and his appearance had been altered drastically. Finn's distended belly hung over the waistband of his trademark shorts. His thick thighs that were no longer muscular jiggled when he ran and bulged under his restraining clothing as well. His head no longer fit his hat as well as it used to, his bloated cheeks that were always flushed from any sort of activity spilled over the opening for his face, as well as a lovely double chin that always seemed to accompany his swollen neck. All of the Candy Kingdom eyed Finn's gut cautiously.

By the time Jake and Finn arrived at the Candy Castle Finn was panting like an animal, bending down and causing his shirt to ride up his tummy, exposing the soft pale expanded flesh that lay underneath accidentally. Despite all the ice cream he ate on the way there he was very tired, parched and yes, hungry. After walking up a flight of stairs they ran into Princess Bubblegum, who stopped in her tracks. She stared at Finn and his new body for what seemed like a long time, eventually just whispering something to Peppermint Butler who giggled, looked at Finn's belly and walked away. Saying nothing about Finn, she greeted the two like nothing ever changed and led them both to the lab, telling Jake to go back to the treehouse and that she wouldn't be needing his assistance. A very disgruntled Jake walked off muttering something crass about being discluded. When Jake was out of sight the Princess lifted Finn's soft belly and let it fall back into it's place she licked her lips and pushed him tummy first onto a table with a largely circular incision in the center that allowed his girth to hang pendulously. She admired it for a few short seconds as she placed a small tube connected to an oral mask to Finn's struggling face. Princess Bubblegum told him, " Don't even try to escape from this one Finn, I've been looking forward to stuffing you for a while now and here you went and started without me", she said playfully smacking his hanging gut. Finn helplessly watched as Princess Bubblegum began turning a series of dials that eventually lead to a greasy yet creamy, thick yet smooth formula flowing through the tube that not only acted as as an anesthetic but as a very quickly filling solution as well. 10 seconds in Finn already felt his tummy swinging and pendulously shifting due to added weight until what felt like forever from that time he felt the liquid stop flowing. A mirror was placed in front of him, and at that very moment he realized that none of his shirts would fit anymore and that he officially had a gut. It stretched out far in front of him and caused him to waddle a little bit at first but with practice he got used to it. Eventually, it began to sag and gave him a very portly look.

112.content:
The door to the treehouse swung open, and Finn and Jake walked through, completely covered in blood from head to toe. Their features were indiscernible underneath the thick coat of red, not a single color was visible but the blood that soaked their bodies. BMO screamed, raising his fists. "Bandits! Get out! Before I call the police! Don't make me use my martial arts on you!"

Finn chuckled, wiping his eyes clean. "Haha, it's just us, BMO. Chill." The little game system relaxed, lowering his arms. Finn jumped onto the ladder leading up to the main floor, with Jake stretching his way up behind him.

"Man, I still can't believe how you skronked up that Goblin king!" Jake boasted as the brothers ascended the ladder. Finn paused, turning around with a sullen look in his eyes.

"He got what was coming to him." he said in a low voice. The two made their way over to the living room table, sitting down at the couch.

"Yeah, yeah, heroism and everything, I get it." Jake quipped sarcastically as he sat next to Finn. "But enough of that jazz, let's bust out the loot!" Finn dumped out his backpack to divide the spoils of their quest.

Coins and jewelry spilled across the table, accompanied by gems and weapons of all sorts. As the flow of treasure ebbed, one final thing fell from Finn's pack. A glass sphere, enchanted with what appeared to be a black hole in the center.

"I CALL THAT ONE!" Finn yelled quickly, grabbing the ball from the top of the pile. Jake looked crestfallen.

"I wanted that one! Hhmph!" he crossed his arms. "Well, I get the rest of it if you get that thing." Finn was too entranced with his new possession to care.

"Sure, take it man." Finn stared into his trinket, holding it with his blood-soaked hands and admiring the spiraling patterns inside. Jake looked over, obviously envious, before grabbing all the treasure with his stretchy arms and storming off, pieces of gold and gems falling from his grasp.

"Fine, didn't want it anyway... stupid sphere." he muttered under his breath as he walked away.

Meanwhile, Finn continued to stare into the orb as the black hole churned away inside. He felt as though he wanted to get closer to the sphere, to get inside... just watch it forever... Finn almost passed out in his trance, sending the ball falling out of his hands.

"Oh snap!" Finn cried as he realized what had happened. The orb careened towards the ground, finally smashing on the ground. Wisps of dark energy flew from the shards and spun around Finn.

"Uhhh... Jake?" he tried to cry out, but his voice was made quiet by the veil of energy surrounding him. The wisps rotated faster and faster, engulfing Finn in a shroud of rotating darkness. He closed his eyes, feeling sure that he was about to die. Finn quivered as he awaited the end, but suddenly the energy stopped. That is, before the wisps flew directly into his stomach.

Cautiously, Finn opened his eyes. He felt like the wind had been knocked out of him, but he was alive. He patted himself all over, laughing manically. He was alive! Finn looked down, remembering the smashing of the orb, but the floor was perfectly clear of any debris. Had it happened at all? Finn was sure that he was surrounded by dark energy only moments ago, but he didn't feel tired or sick. He just felt... hungry. Finn grabbed his stomach, looking around the treehouse. Jake and BMO were nowhere to be seen. Maybe he had imagined the whole ordeal? Getting up from the couch, his stomach rumbled. Finn decided he needed to do something.

Before Finn could question what the orb had just done to him, his stomach erupted into the worst hunger pangs he had ever felt.

"Oh glob, I need food now!" moaned Finn as he clutched his stomach in pain.

Finn raced into the kitchen, flung open the refrigerator door,and scanned the shelves for any food, finding nothing but a few scraps and crumbs.
.
"I told Jake to get more food two days ago!'

Finn rifled through the cupboards and cabinets in desperation, gobbling down any scraps of food he saw. After searching the kitchen high and low, Finn, frustrated and starving decided that there was only one other option. Rushing into the bedroom he lifted up a loose plank of wood that hid Jake's Ice Cream stash.

He reached into the hole and pulled out a tub of Chocolate ice cream, tearing the lid off like a starving animal. Finn dunked his head into the tub, ice cream splattering over his face and clothes. He moaned in ecstasy as it went down his gullet, loving the feeling of it filling his empty belly. He reached the bottom of the carton in less than a minute, tossing the empty carton away and replacing it with a new one. He emptied the next one just as fast, reaching for another new one to repeat the process. He gorged on the dairy treats until Jake's ice cream stash had been turned into a mess of empty cartons and a very messy, very bloated Finn.

"Ohhhh, *BuhRaaPP~* I think that filled me up." Finn groaned as he lay down on the floor, face contorted in pain and pleasure from the pressure in his gut. After a few minutes Finn began to yawn, drowsy from his binge.

"I guess a little nap wouldn't hurt."

~One Hour Later~,

"Oh my Holy Grob!" Jake exclaimed as he walked in to the bedroom, having returned only a few moments ago from a visit to his girlfriend Lady Rainicorn. "Finn, wake up bro, wake up!"

Finn snapped to consciousness, not having any memory of what had occurred only an hour before. "Huh, wha-, what is it Jake?" He tried to pull himself up but lost his footing. Looking for the cause of his unbalance Finn looked down at his belly to see a potbelly protruding from where was once a flat stomach. In fact, it appeared that all of Finn's body had gained a thin layer of pudge!

"Jake, what the flip happened here, why is my gut so big?!"

"I don't know bro, but whoever did it probably ate my ice cream too!" Jake replied.

Suddenly the sound of maniacal laughter could be heard from behind them. Both Finn and Jake turned around to see..........!

121.content:
It was another beautiful day in the Candy Kingdom and the ruler of the candy people was in her lab working on one of her many experiments. Princess Bubblegum was engaged in her research with her lab rat Science in a cage next to her. Her current project was to create a compound that would allow her to no longer require sleep so she could run the Candy Kingdom and do her other experiments. She was concentrating on putting the right amount of candy matter in the mix and needed absolutely no distractions.

A knock on the door startled her as Peppermint Butler called out, "Your highness, you have visitors."

"Whuh?" She muttered, knocking over a beaker with a red compound accidentally into the mixture without her awareness. "I'll be right out." She responded. Bubblegum returned her attention to the substance without noticing the change. She added the final drop, stirred the mixture together and examined the product. She felt her eye lids get heavy and nearly dozed off but stopped herself and decided to test the compound. Bubblegum chugged the chemical and sighed. She let out a belch that surprised her and wondered if it worked. So far she didn't feel drowsy but it might be because she was so eager to see if her experiment worked.

"*Sigh* I guess I'll have to wait and see if there are any changes." She said to herself. Bubblegum decided now would be a good time to get up and see who was came to see her. Little did she know that her experiment had gone wrong and that instead of keeping her awake it would make her fatter. Her body would produce more fat cells, she would have a bigger appetite, and change over time. Just as she reached for the door knob she thought she felt something inside of her.

"RAAAAAR! TAKE THAT, WALKING SPAGHETTI MONSTER!"

Finn's sword cleaved through the noodly body of the titanic sauce-drenched beast with the sound of a thousand rubber bands snapping. The monster began to unravel and slither to the paving stones of the Candy Kingdom. Finn turned away and raised his sword in triumph over his head.

"Yeah! Wait." He lowered the sword. "Aw man, my hat's all drippy now. Good think the stains are red, I can just have Marceline--"

"Dude, behind you!" Jake shouted. Finn turned back just in time to see a single noodle-tentacle, tipped with a heavy looking meatball, globber its way out of the mass and launch itself towards Princess Bubblegum in one last desperate grab.

"No you don't!" he yelled, slicing through the spaghetti. The tentacle collapsed, and the meatball dropped, bounced, and rolled to a stop right at Bubblegum's feet. Finn leaped into the mound of pasta and began hacking angrily.

"Yeah! That's the way!" Jake said happily. "I'm punching it! I dunno if that works on spaghetti, but I'm not taking any chances!"

"That's enough!" Bubblegum said. "It's dead, Finn. It's finally dead."

Finn picked up a limp noodle and tossed it away. "Oh, yeah. Huh."

"Thank you both!" Bubblegum continued, taking a bite out of the meatball. "You saved the Candy Kingdom! The Walking Spaghetti Monsters were ancient enemies of Glob. Everyone thought they were sealed away forever, until someone undid the stasis spell around Prince Spaghetti's domain."

"I said I was sorry!" came the Ice King's muffled voice from somewhere under the pile of pasta.

"No, you didn't."

"Well, I was thinking it when it ate me!"

"So what do you want us to do with all this stuff? Huck it into the ocean like we did with all those other dead monsters?" Jake asked, turning into a bulldozer.

"Um, no. That would be a waste. You should leave it to me. I'm sure I can... can think of something productive to do with it."

"Whoa, P-Bubz, you're not gonna eat it, are you?" Finn asked. "Cause that stuff's been on the ground."

Jake nodded. "Yeah, and on the Ice King."

"Not all of it," Bubblegum said defensively. "Just the bottom part."

"Just get some containers from the Tupperware kingdom, silly." They all slapped their heads and collectively went, "Oooh."

Later that day in the Candy Kingdom. Night has fallen. Instead of being fast asleep like the rest of the Candy Kingdom, Princess Bubblegum sits in her lab and empties a bag that she had found earlier.

To her surprise the contents were filled with miniature version of her friends and enemies. Finn, Jake, Ice King, Marceline, and so on. Even Bubblegum herself was there.

"Weird."

Instantly, they began to interact with each other in their own language.

"So what were you guys doing in a bag in the river?" she questioned them. No one them answered. She figured their had to be some explanation for that some how.

For who knows how long, she sat and stared at them. Watching as they interacted with one another. Although, things became different. People who should be friends and people who should be enemies were switched.

"Weird." escaped from her lips again.

"Zarkleberries, my stomach's empty. I'll be back."

Bubblegum straightened out her lab coat before exiting. "I hope the banana guards did a well enough job of packing that spaghetti." Bubblegum entered the royal kitchen and noticed the fridge just a big as the monster that was slain earlier today.

Inside, she was delighted. The spaghetti was neatly packed in containers varying in sizes. It wreaked on meat sauce and garlic. "Magnificent." she gasped.

Back in the room, Bubblegum brought in a warmed container of spaghetti and returned her attention to the little people, "Okay. One more hour of this and then I've got to go to bed."

Little did Bubblegum know, spaghetti, watching and messing with the little people, and sleeping would become her new obsession for quite some time.

Before anyone could, Bubblegum hung a 'Do not Disturb' sign on the front door.

The Gates of the Candy Castle stood proudly. Protecting the building they surround in all their candy-coated glory. Down at the ground level a duo of Banana Guards holds their post to maintain the business of who can go in and out. Well…they were before they fell asleep. Now they stand as limp as the noodles in Jake’s famous spaghetti. Beyond the two slumbering guards were to Gumball Guardians who busied themselves with a game of cards.

Inside the tall Candy Castle, an organized sort of business goes about without a hitch or any foreseeable mishap. The Candy Castle is as clean as it ever was and remains peaceful like it has for the past month. For the past month, the number of chaotic occurrences has been at an all-time low; Zero. No giant monsters, no sudden appearances from Finn and Jake, no Ice King, no…anything. While these occurrences led to all sorts of chaotic destruction one resident of the Candy Kingdom grew bored with the peace. That person is Princess Bubblegum.

No new scientific discovers or adventures had come her way, forcing her to explore new hobbies. Out of all that she tried, one stuck to her. As well as her ribs. The Culinary Arts. Particularly the consuming aspect of the Culinary Arts. Bubblegum worked with the royal chefs to improve their quality by assigned her as the royal taste tester.

This recent spike in boredom led Princess Bubblegum to dive into another hobby. The Culinary Arts. More like the aspect of consuming the Culinary Arts. At first, things started off innocently. She would eat a slice of cake and simply critique it. Giving them a review in areas like texture and flavor. Overtime, Bubblegum’s authoritative nature began to infiltrate her hobby. The Pink Bubblegum royalty began to demand more quality and importantly more food. Since then her one taste for a day became whole meals. Then those whole meals became the three-square meals a day. As a result, her exploration into the world of flavor increased the once Petite Princess into a Queen-sized body.

Now, a month in, things haven’t gotten out of control…yet…but Bubblegum has fallen in love with the habit of snacking.

"Peppermint Butler!"

“The Princess! She needs me! Finally!” His short, red stripped legs pumped as fast as they could to aid the Princess in need. He climbed many a stair case and performed sweet tricks to cut the travel time in half. He finally arrived at the source of PB’s call. Her room, particularly at the balcony, “Yes, my princess!”

Peppermint Butler’s excitement was short-lived by Bubblegum’s “situation”.
His sight is filled by the over corpulent Princess Bubblegum, a chubby form of herself wriggling her plump fingers towards a box of donuts just out of reach. "I can't reach the box of donuts," Bubblegum wheezed, "Push them closer, will ya?"

Peppermint sighed and did as he was instructed. He pushed the box closer for Bubblegum to snatch them off the table and cram the contents into her mouth in seconds. He received a muffled ‘Thank You’ as a reward. She received the donuts well by a satisfied belch and a lick of her icing stained lips. Peppermint Butler looked at Princess Bubblegum with only a fraction of the respect he once had. While the Princess still carried her simple face (only look a bit more plump), Peppermint could see the gluttonous greed growing inside her.

Clearly, Princess Bubblegum unapologetically squeezed herself into one of her beloved outfits (yellow shirt with a big horizontal pink stripe and white shorts). The shirt clung tightly to her torso were it formerly hung loosely. Countering every dessert she’s stuffed herself with in the form of a pudgy stomach, thick love handles, and a bountiful bust. Her meaty arms are being cut into by the sleeves just like her growing thighs are being cut into by her shorts.

Peppermint Butler felt the courage welling inside his circular body. If her doesn’t speak out, this problem Bubblegum is ignoring is sure to grow out of control. He cleared his throat and let the words come out, "Princess, while I do like how you're...enjoying yourself...don't you think it's time to get back into the swing of things?"

The words ‘back into the swing of things’ clicked with Bubblegum. She sat upright and quickly tugged her shirt only to have it return to its improper position; way above her belly button. “W-what do you mean?” Peppermint Butler held his courageous tongue. He didn’t want to say too much of the truth. That the Princess had become the living meaning of the term 'Let yourself go'.

Bubblegum rose to her feet emitting an exclaimed grunt, "Everything is fine, PB!" She extended a chunky arm outward, "I've never seen the Candy Kingdom so peaceful on an average day."

Peppermint Butler caught glimpses of Bubblegum's rotund butt cheeks peeking from her shorts. The top and bottom were exposed. They wiggled wildly with each careful step she took. He feared that she's only a few eclairs away from tearing her shorts to ribbons. He took the eclair platter and tossed them off the balcony.

"At the very least, please join me for a jog around the kingdom. For old times’ sake."

Princess Bubblegum took a deep breath, pushing her stomach out forward just a tad, "...Ugh..."
